body:
oh, Hi, you could call me :)

@mrbrdo thank you for awesome efforts, idea of checking formats on bootstrap is nice.

I'm not sure but this is how I have been writing code a few years ago:
```
unless url =~ /^http/
  url = "http://#{utl}"
end
```
because validator cannot add 'http' if user forgot it and the code is explicit thus patch will not check it. that's how I exploited 'javascript:' urls. 

I would be just happy if there were an option Regexp.multiline which we could set to +false+ built in ruby. But I don't see any way or trick, metaprogramming not works here :(

PS not sure about backport.. people always get mad when something gets broken. I only want make rails *4* super secure, 3 is pretty old :)
